==Events==
*[[1548]] &ndash; The city of Nuestra Señora de [[La Paz]] ([[Blessed Virgin Mary|Our Lady]] of Peace) is founded by [[Alonso de Mendoza]] by appointment of the king of [[Spain]] and [[Holy Roman Emperor]], [[Charles V, Holy Roman Emperor|Charles V]].
*[[1572]] &ndash; [[Relief of Goes]], [[Cristóbal de Mondragón]] with 3000 soldiers of the Spanish Tercios, release the siege of the city.
*[[1720]] &ndash; Caribbean pirate [[Calico Jack]] is [[Capture of the William|captured]] by the [[Royal Navy]].
*[[1740]] &ndash; [[Maria Theresa of Austria|Maria Theresa]] takes the throne of [[Holy Roman Empire|Austria]]. [[Kingdom of France|France]], [[Kingdom of Prussia|Prussia]], [[Electorate of Bavaria|Bavaria]] and [[Electorate of Saxony|Saxony]] refuse to honour the [[Pragmatic Sanction of 1713|Pragmatic Sanction]] and the [[War of the Austrian Succession]] begins.
*[[1781]] &ndash; [[Patent of Toleration]], providing limited [[freedom of religion|freedom of worship]], is approved in [[Habsburg Monarchy]].
*[[1803]] &ndash; The [[United States Senate]] ratifies the [[Louisiana Purchase]].
*[[1818]] &ndash; [[Treaty of 1818|The Convention of 1818]] signed between the United States and the United Kingdom which, among other things, settles the [[Canada – United States border]] on the [[49th parallel north|49th parallel]] for most of its length.
*[[1827]] &ndash; [[Battle of Navarino]]: a combined [[Ottoman Empire|Turkish]] and [[Khedivate of Egypt|Egypt]]ian armada is defeated by [[United Kingdom|British]], [[Bourbon Restoration|French]], and [[Russian Empire|Russia]]n naval force in the port of Navarino in Pylos, [[Greece]].
*[[1873]] &ndash; [[Yale University|Yale]], [[Princeton University|Princeton]], [[Columbia University|Columbia]], and [[Rutgers University|Rutgers]] universities draft the first code of [[American football]] rules.
*[[1883]] &ndash; [[Peru]] and [[Chile]] sign the [[Treaty of Ancón]], by which the [[Tarapacá Region|Tarapacá]] province is ceded to the latter, bringing an end to Peru's involvement in the [[War of the Pacific]].
*[[1904]] &ndash; Chile and Bolivia sign the [[Treaty of Peace and Friendship (1904)|Treaty of Peace and Friendship]], delimiting the border between the two countries.
*[[1910]] &ndash; The hull of the {{RMS|Olympic}}, sister-ship to the ill-fated {{RMS|Titanic}}, is launched from the [[Harland and Wolff]] [[shipyard]] in [[Belfast]], [[Northern Ireland]].
*[[1935]] &ndash; The [[Long March]], a mammoth retreat undertaken by the armed forces of the [[Communist Party of China|Chinese Communist Party]] a year prior, ends.
*[[1939]] &ndash; [[Pope Pius XII]] publishes his first major [[encyclical]] entitled ''[[Summi Pontificatus]]''.
*[[1941]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: Thousands of civilians in [[Kragujevac]] in [[Nedić's Serbia|German-occupied Serbia]] are murdered in the [[Kragujevac massacre]].
*[[1943]] &ndash; The cargo vessel [[French ship Sinfra|''Sinfra'']] is attacked by Allied aircraft at [[Suda Bay]], [[Crete]], and sunk. 2,098 Italian prisoners of war drown with it.
*[[1944]] &ndash; The [[Soviet Army]] and [[Partisans (Yugoslavia)|Yugoslav Partisans]] liberate [[Belgrade]], the capital of [[Kingdom of Yugoslavia|Yugoslavia]]
*  1944   &ndash; Liquid [[Cleveland East Ohio Gas explosion|''natural gas]] leaks from storage tanks in [[Cleveland]], then explodes; the explosion and resulting fire level 30 blocks and kill 130.
*  1944   &ndash; American [[general]] [[Douglas MacArthur]] fulfills his promise to return to the [[Philippines]] when he commands [[Battle of Leyte|an Allied assault]] on the islands, reclaiming them from the [[Japan]]ese during the [[Second World War]].
*[[1946]] &ndash; Government of the [[North Vietnam|Democratic Republic of Vietnam]] decides that on 20/10 is [[Vietnam Women's Day]].
*[[1947]] &ndash; The [[House Un-American Activities Committee]] begins its investigation into [[Communism|Communist]] infiltration of [[Hollywood]], resulting in [[Hollywood blacklist|a blacklist]] that prevents some from working in the industry for years.
*  1947   &ndash; [[United States–Pakistan relations|United States of America and Islamic Republic of Pakistan]] establish [[diplomatic relations]] for the first time.
*[[1951]] &ndash; The "[[Johnny Bright Incident]]" occurs in [[Stillwater, Oklahoma|Stillwater]], [[Oklahoma]]
*[[1952]] &ndash; [[Colonial Heads of Kenya|Governor]] [[Evelyn Baring, 1st Baron Howick of Glendale|Evelyn Baring]] declares a [[state of emergency]] in [[Kenya]] and begins arresting hundreds of suspected leaders of the [[Mau Mau Uprising]], including [[Jomo Kenyatta]], the future first [[Heads of state of Kenya|President of Kenya]].
*[[1961]] &ndash; The Soviet Union performs the first armed test of a [[submarine-launched ballistic missile]], launching an [[R-13 (missile)|R-13]] from a [[Golf-class submarine]].
*[[1962]] &ndash; People's Republic of China launches simultaneous offensives in [[Ladakh]] and across the [[McMahon Line]], igniting the [[Sino-Indian War]].
*[[1968]] &ndash; Former [[First Lady of the United States|First Lady]] [[Jacqueline Kennedy]] marries [[Greece|Greek]] shipping tycoon [[Aristotle Onassis]].
*[[1970]] &ndash; [[Siad Barre]] declares [[Somali Democratic Republic|Somalia]] a [[socialist state]].
*[[1971]] &ndash; The [[Nepal Stock Exchange]] collapses.
*[[1973]] &ndash; "[[Saturday Night Massacre]]": [[President of the United States|President]] [[Richard Nixon]] fires [[United States Attorney General|U.S. Attorney General]] [[Elliot Richardson]] and [[United States Deputy Attorney General|Deputy Attorney General]] [[William Ruckelshaus]] after they refuse to fire [[Watergate scandal|Watergate]] [[special prosecutor]] [[Archibald Cox]], who is finally fired by [[Robert Bork]].
*  1973   &ndash; The [[Sydney Opera House]] opens.
*[[1976]] &ndash; The [[ferry]] [[MV George Prince ferry disaster|''George Prince'']] is struck by a ship while crossing the [[Mississippi River]] between [[Destrehan, Louisiana|Destrehan]] and [[Luling, Louisiana]]. Seventy-eight passengers and crew die and only 18 people aboard the ferry survive.
*[[1977]] &ndash; Rock band [[Lynyrd Skynyrd]]'s plane crashes.
*[[1981]] &ndash; Two police officers and an armored car guard are killed during an [[Brink's robbery (1981)|armed robbery]] in [[Rockland County, NY]], carried out by members of the [[Black Liberation Army]] and [[Weather Underground]].
*[[1982]] &ndash; During the [[UEFA Cup]] match between [[FC Spartak Moscow]] and [[HFC Haarlem]], 66 people are crushed to death in the [[Luzhniki disaster]].
*[[1991]] &ndash; The [[Oakland Hills firestorm]] kills 25 and destroys 3,469 homes and apartments, causing more than $2 billion in damage.
*  1991   &ndash; A 6.8 [[Moment magnitude scale|M<sub>w</sub>]] earthquake [[1991 Uttarkashi earthquake|strikes]] the [[Uttarkashi]] region of India, killing more than 1,000 people.
*[[2011]] &ndash; [[Libyan civil war]]: [[National Transitional Council]] rebel forces capture ousted Libyan dictator [[Muammar Gaddafi]] in his hometown of [[Sirte]] and [[Death of Muammar Gaddafi|kill him]] shortly thereafter.
